ARTICLE II. TAXICABS



DIVISION 1. GENERALLY



Sec. 118-31. Definitions.



   The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this article,
shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the
context clearly indicates a different meaning:



   Owner  means every person having the use or control of one or more
taxicab or livery service vehicle.



   Public vehicle means any taxicab, bus, automobile or other similar
vehicle used in the business of carrying persons for hire upon the public
streets of the village.



   Taxicab means a motor vehicle regularly engaged in the business of
carrying persons for hire except for a livery service and those vehicles
commonly known as buses.



   Taximeter means a mechanical or electrical instrument or device by
which the charge for hire of a taxicab is mechanically calculated, either for
distance traveled or for waiting time, or for both, and upon such charge
shall be indicated by means of dollars and cents.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(a))



   Cross reference(s)--Definitions generally, § 1-2.



Sec. 118-32. Vehicles.



   (a)   No taxicab shall be operated unless it bears a current state
license and unless it meets the following standards:



      (1)   The vehicle's brake system and its component parts are
in good working order.



      (2)   The vehicle's steering system and its component parts
are in good working order.



      (3)   The vehicle exhaust system is in good working order and
firmly affixed.



      (4)   The vehicle's suspension system and its component parts
are in good working order.



      (5)   The vehicle's lighting equipment, including high and low
beam, parking, directional, tail, stop and license illuminating lights are in
good working order.



      (6)   The vehicle's cooling and heating system, water hoses,
fan and belts are in good working order.



      (7)   The vehicle's tires, wheels, and lugs are in good
condition. A set of tires shall be properly matched and the tread depth shall
not be less than 1/16 of an inch.



      (8)   The vehicle's windshield wiper blades, motor and washer
are in good working order.



      (9)   The vehicle's horn is in good working order.



      (10)   The vehicle's glass and mirror including all exterior
glass, windshield, sides and rear windows including rear vision mirrors is
unbroken and in good operating condition.



      (11)   The vehicle's exterior appearances including paint,
lettering and chrome is in good condition and free from excessive rust. Each
taxicab, while operated, shall have distinctly and clearly painted on the
door panel or panels of each side of the vehicle in letters not less than
four inches in height, the name of the licensee. If more than one cab is
operated by a licensee, each cab shall be designated by a different number,
and such number shall be distinctly and clearly painted on each side of such
vehicle.



      (12)   The vehicle's interior is clean, sanitary and the
upholstery is in good repair.



   (b)   It shall be the duty of each taxicab business to have every
taxicab inspected at the time of licensing and on a quarterly basis
thereafter. Such inspections shall be conducted at a garage approved by the
village manager or his designee. The taxicab business licensee shall be
responsible for paying the inspection fee. A written report of each
inspection shall be provided by the business licensee to the village manager
(or his designee). In addition to regular inspections, the village may
inspect any taxicab vehicle at any time.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(f))



Sec. 118-33. Driver's conduct.



   A driver of a taxicab while on duty shall not drink any intoxicating
liquor, or use any illegal drugs, or use any obscene, as such term is defined
in 720 ILCS 5/11-20(b), language, or shout or call to prospective passengers,
or disturb the peace in any way, or make any gesture towards or speak to any
prospective passenger in order to solicit his business.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(k))



Sec. 118-34. Interference with traffic by driver.



   It shall be unlawful for the driver of any taxicab to seek employment
by interfering or obstructing the normal movement of traffic on public
streets or by interfering with the proper and orderly access to or egress
from any theater, hall, hotel, public resort, or other place of public
gathering.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(l))



Sec. 118-35. Use of taxicab to commit crime.



   No person shall knowingly permit any taxicab to be used in perpetration
of a crime or misdemeanor.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(m))



Sec. 118-36. Passengers.



   (a)   The driver of any taxicab shall accept as a passenger any
person who seeks to so use the taxicab, provided such person conducts himself
in an orderly manner. Service shall be provided without regard to a person's
race, color, religion, national origin, sex, or familial status. No person
shall be admitted to a taxicab occupied by a passenger if the passenger
objects to sharing the cab with such person.



   (b)   The driver shall take his passenger to the passenger's
destination by the most direct available route with reasonable promptness
from the place where the passenger enters the cab.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(n))



Sec. 118-37. Fares, payments and taximeters.



   (a)   No driver of any taxicab shall charge or attempt to charge any
passenger a fare greater than allowed as follows:



      (1)   Mileage rates. The fare charged by any taxi company
licensed under the provisions of this article shall be no more than $1.25
minimum, plus $0.12 for each one-tenth of a mile or portion thereof.



      (2)   Hourly rate and baggage charge. Waiting time may be
charged at a rate of $0.15 per minute. An additional charge of $0.25 may be
charged for each item of baggage, parcels or groceries, to a maximum rate of
$1.00 per trip, except for baggage, parcels or groceries which because of
their size may be carried on the lap or directly in front of the passenger.
No charge shall be made for such items.



      (3)   Deliveries. The rate for all deliveries shall be the
fare for passengers, plus $1.00. The company may reserve the right to refuse
deliveries of freight or goods.



      (4)   Additional passengers. When more than one passenger
shares a taxicab, each to a different location, each such passenger shall be
charged a separate full fare for that trip. The fare for one or more
additional passengers over 12 years of age picked up and discharged at the
same point as the first passenger shall be $0.50 per each additional
passenger, with no charge for such children 12 years of age or younger.



      (5)   Odometer reading. The driver of each taxicab shall, on
request, inform the passenger of the odometer reading upon his entry into the
cab and again upon arrival at the passenger's destination. Verification of
such readings may be made by the passenger if desired.



      (6)   Posting fare schedule. There shall be affixed on the
inside of each taxicab a copy of the fare schedule on file in the village
clerk's office in a conspicuous place and in such a manner that it may be
conveniently and easily read by any person riding in such taxicab. A card
clearly displaying the full name of the driver of the taxicab shall be
similarly affixed.



      (7)   Payment; receipt. Upon paying his fare, each passenger,
if he so requests, shall be given a receipt showing the amount so paid, the
date of payment, the name of the company or person operating the cab, and the
number of the cab if such company or person operates more than one taxicab in
the village. A passenger shall pay the lawful fare at the termination of a
trip.



      (8)   Reduced fares. Reduced fares shall be as follows:



         a.   Each taxicab licensee may sell special reduced rate
coupon books without village approval in each instance. The books shall
provide for rates which do not exceed the rates established by this section.



         b.   Each taxicab licensee shall provide and sell to
senior citizens, age 65 or over, reduced rate coupon books which result in a
ten percent rate reduction for each ride.



      (9)   Changing rates. The board of trustees, by ordinance, may
from time to time amend the rates as listed in this section, provided that
first class mail notice of the proposed rate changes is given to the taxicab
business licenseholders at least ten days in advance of the meeting at which
the ordinance is to be considered.



      (10)   Taximeters. Every licensee shall cause taximeters to be
installed in every taxicab used in the village. The taximeters shall be set
to reflect the rates established by this section, including any future
amendments of this section, and shall be located in the taxicab so that the
cost of the trip shall be clearly visible to passengers within the taxicab.
All meters shall be subject to inspection by the village, at the licensee's
expense, at any time.



   (b)   In addition, every licensee shall inspect its meters at least
every three months and shall file a written report of such inspection with
the village manager. Such report shall verify that each meter is presently
working properly, if such is the case, recite a history of any maintenance
performed on any meter and recite what maintenance is presently necessary to
make each meter work properly and when such maintenance will be accomplished.
Any meter known to the licensee to be defective shall be immediately repaired
and taken out of service until such repairs are accomplished.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(o))



Sec. 118-38. Cabstands.



   (a)   Cabstands shall be designated by the board of trustees. Each
cabstand shall be appropriately marked by signs erected under the supervision
of the director of public works. No person shall park any vehicle, other than
a licensed taxicab, in any cabstand. No taxicab shall park on, enter into, or
upon any cabstand on public property, as designated by the board of trustees,
unless the taxicab is owned and operated by the taxicab firm or company which
is operating under a class 1 taxicab business license.



   (b)   A licensed taxicab operating under a class 1 taxicab business
license may be parked in a public street cabstand while such taxicab is in
charge of its driver on duty awaiting a fare. The driver of such taxicab may
leave the taxicab for periods of short duration in order to aid fares in
boarding the vehicle and/or loading luggage and parcels.



   (c)   The inverted parking area located on the west side of Harwood
Avenue, beginning approximately 300 feet south of Ridge Road is hereby
designated as a cabstand. This designation is hereby made until revoked or
modified by future action of the board of trustees of the village.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(p))



Sec. 118-39. Daily manifest to be maintained.



   Each taxicab business licensee shall require each driver to maintain a
daily manifest upon which are recorded the serial number of the taxicab, and
the odometer total mileage reading at the beginning and end of driver's tour
of duty, and for each revenue trip made, the date, time and place of origin,
place of destination, number of passengers and amount of fare collected.
Manifest forms shall be furnished to the driver by the licensee and shall,
upon completion of the driver's tour of duty, be returned to licensee, who
shall retain every manifest as part of his records, available for inspection
by village officials on request, for at least six months.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(q))



Sec. 118-40. Specific contracts.



   The provisions of this division shall not affect the right of a duly
licensed taxicab business operating duly licensed taxicabs to enter into
private contracts, whether verbal or written, with any person for a regular
carrying for hire or special persons or groups, as the parties may contract.
However, nothing in this section shall authorize any taxicab licensee to
negotiate fares upon any pickup in the usual course of business.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(r))



Secs. 118-41--118-60. Reserved.



DIVISION 2. LICENSES



Sec. 118-61. Required; classes.



   No person shall operate or permit a taxicab owned or controlled by him
to be operated as a vehicle for hire upon the streets of the village without
having first obtained licenses as required by this section. Taxicabs shall be
permitted to deliver passengers picked up outside of the village to a
destination in the village without any licenses issued by the village.
Licenses shall be required as follows:



      (1)   A class 1 taxicab business license shall be required of
any taxicab business that picks up passengers in the village whether or not
such pickup has been prearranged by the passenger. Taxicabs operating under a
class 1 taxicab business license may pick up passengers who beckon, hail, or
otherwise approach the taxicab without making any previous arrangements for
service by the taxicab.



      (2)   A class 2 taxicab business license shall be required of
any taxicab business that picks up passengers in the village only where the
passenger has prearranged for service by the taxicab. Taxicabs operating
under a class 2 taxicab business license may not pick up passengers who
beckon, hail, or otherwise approach the taxicab unless the passenger has made
previous arrangements for service by the taxicab.



      (3)   Each taxicab operated by a licensee shall also be
required to have a separate taxicab vehicle license issued by the village.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(b))



Sec. 118-62. Transfer.



   No taxicab business license may be sold, assigned, mortgaged or
otherwise transferred.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(c))



Sec. 118-63. Application.



   (a)   Applications for taxicab business licenses shall be made in
writing to the village clerk, and shall state thereon the name of the
applicant, the class of license requested, the intended place of business,
the number of cabs to be operated, and such other information regarding the
vehicles that may be required by the village manager. If the applicant is a
corporation, the names and addresses of the president and secretary of such
corporation shall be given.



   (b)   No taxicab business license shall be issued to or held by any
person who has been convicted of a felony; nor shall such license be issued
to or held by any corporation if any officer thereof would be ineligible for
a license under such conditions.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(d))



Sec. 118-64. Fees.



   (a)   The annual fee for each taxicab business license is $50.00.
There shall be no fee for each taxicab vehicle license. Whenever the number
of cabs operated is increased during the license year, the licensee shall
notify the village clerk of such change. The fee for business licenses
obtained during the year shall not be prorated. Upon proper application to
the village clerk, an existing taxicab vehicle license may be transferred to
a new vehicle replacing it.



   (b)   Such business license fees shall be in addition to any other
vehicle fees required by this Code, and the village clerk shall issue
suitable and plainly visible window stickers for each taxicab covered by each
new or transferred license. Such tag or sticker shall be displayed on the
lower righthand corner of the front window of each taxicab while it is in use.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(e))



Sec. 118-65. Abandonment, nonuse, and revocation.



   (a)   If the owner of any taxicab business license fails to obtain
licenses for and regularly operate the minimum number of taxicabs required
for a period of 30 consecutive days, such license shall be considered
abandoned and automatically revoked and shall not be reinstated except under
the procedures required for obtaining new licenses. Regular operation shall
mean that all required vehicles are in public service at least eight hours of
every day and that at least one is in public service during any given hour of
each 24-hour day.



   (b)   Any individual taxicab vehicle license shall be considered
abandoned and automatically revoked if such licensed vehicle is not operated
in the public service at least eight hours during one day in any consecutive
30-day period, unless the owner notifies the village clerk that he intends to
temporarily remove such cab from service and reinstate at a later date, under
which circumstances the reinstatement charge after proper application to the
clerk shall be $2.00.



   (c)   Taxicab business licenses, individual vehicle licenses, and
village taxicab driver's licenses may be revoked at any time by the village
manager for failure to maintain the standards as described in this section or
for other cause. License revocations may be appealed to the board of trustees
in writing within ten days after receipt of the revocation notice. After
suitable inquiry, the board of trustees may sustain or reverse the
revocation. During any appeal process, the revocation shall remain in effect
unless otherwise directed by the board of trustees.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(h))



Sec. 118-66. Limitations on number of taxicab businesses and individual
taxicab licenses.



   (a)   The total number of class 1 taxicab business licenses issued
in the village shall be one. The president and board of trustees may by
ordinance increase this number, provided an investigation by the board of
trustees indicates the change is necessary to the public's welfare and meets
the public's demands for such service. Class 1 taxicab business
licenseholders shall be required to have at least four taxicabs licensed by
the village at all times.



   (b)   The total number of class 2 taxicab business licenses issued
by the village shall be three. Class 2 taxicab business licenseholders shall
be required to have at least one taxicab licensed by the village at all times.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(g), Ord. No. MC-565, 9-10-96)



Sec. 118-67. Insurance.



   (a)   The licensee shall file with the village a policy of insurance
issued by a company authorized to do business in the state and insuring the
licensee and owner of such vehicle against liability for any damage or injury
to, including death of any person and for damage or injury to property
resulting from the negligence of such licensee, owner or his agent in the
operation of such vehicle. Such policy of insurance may cover one or more
vehicles, but all vehicles operating under the same business license must be
so insured. The limits of liability shall, with respect to each vehicle
covered by such policy, be not less than $250,000.00 for each person and
$350,000.00 for each accident, and for property damage in the amount of
$100,000.00. Such policy of insurance shall provide for the payment and
satisfaction of any final judgment rendered against the licensee or owner of
such vehicle for damage to property or for personal injury, including death.
The policy shall be further endorsed to require 30 days' written notice of
cancellation to the village.



   (b)   If the village receives a notice of cancellation pursuant to
such endorsement, the taxicab business license and all taxicab vehicle
licenses issued pursuant to the terms of this section, shall immediately
terminate as of the effective date of such insurance termination unless the
taxicab business licensee provides a substitute policy of insurance complying
with the provisions of this section.



   (c)   In case a final judgment or claim has been paid by any
indemnitor or insurance policy on behalf of a taxicab business licensee, as a
result of which the original amount of coverage required in this section is
proportionately reduced, the business license and all taxicab vehicle
licenses issued pursuant to the authority granted by this article to that
licensee shall be immediately terminated subject to reinstatement, within 30
days, by replacement of coverage so having demised.



   (d)   The village manager may revoke any taxicab license if any
vehicle so licensed is found to be uninsured according to the terms of this
section.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(i))



Sec. 118-68. State-issued driver's license and village taxicab driver's
license.



   (a)   Required. No person shall drive a taxicab unless he shall have
first secured a valid state driver's license or equivalent and a village
taxicab driver's license. The annual license period shall extend from January
1 to December 31.



   (b)    Fee. The annual fee for a taxicab driver's license shall be
$5.00. Such fee shall not be prorated for a partial year's license, and no
license shall be transferable. No such license shall be automatically renewed.



   (c)   Certificate of fitness. No person shall operate any taxicab in
the village nor be licensed by the village clerk therefor who has not first
applied for and received from the chief of police (or his designee) a
certificate of fitness to drive a public passenger vehicle. Such certificate
shall be issued by the chief of police (or his designee) to any person who
possesses a valid state driver's license or equivalent except as hereinafter
provided.



   (d)   Application. Any person desiring to secure a taxicab driver's
certificate shall make application in writing to the chief of police on a
form provided by the village, and such application shall recite as a minimum
the name and address of the applicant, the name of, and the length of service
with his present employer, and information as to previous employment.



   (e)   Issuance of certificate. No certificate shall be issued by the
chief of police (or his designee) to any person who has been convicted of a
class X felony; provided, however, that upon the written recommendation of
the chief of police, the president of the village, and the village manager,
such certificate may be granted upon consideration of the nature of the
felony, time elapsed since conviction, subsequent criminal convictions, if
any, previous employment record, and any evidence of rehabilitation submitted
by the applicant. Any such certificate may be revoked as provided in section
118-65(c).



   (f)   Display of certificate. A taxicab driver shall either wear on
his person in plain view or display in the taxicab in plain view of
passengers his taxicab driver's certificate.



(Code 1965, § 41.32(j))
